B

Bishop - Class in <Unnamed>
Class that imitates the behavior of the Bishop chess piece
Bishop(String, ChessGame, ChessLocation) - Constructor for class Bishop
Constructor sets the owner, current game, the inital locaiton and the character ID of the Bishop

C

checkLineOfSight(ChessLocation, ChessLocation) - Method in class ChessPiece
Method to check for shadowing of pieces and also checks if there is a piece in the final location
ChessBoard - Class in <Unnamed>
Stores a 2-D array of ChessPieces that can be output in the shape of a chess board
ChessBoard() - Constructor for class ChessBoard
Constructor initalizes the 2-D array with null which is used to symbolize that there are no pieces in that position
ChessGame - Class in <Unnamed>
Initalizes the game and sets up the board with all the pieces on one side, also provides accesors for PlayGame
ChessGame(String, String) - Constructor for class ChessGame
Constructor creates a new ChessBoard object and all of the black pieces then places them on the board at their initial position
ChessLocation - Class in <Unnamed>
Class stores the row and column of any given chess piece
ChessLocation(int, int) - Constructor for class ChessLocation
This constructor populates the row and column values with the user given position
ChessPiece - Class in <Unnamed>
Super Class that all of the different chess pieces inherit from
ChessPiece(String, ChessGame) - Constructor for class ChessPiece
Constructor sets the owner of the piece (player1 or player2) and associates the piece with its game

G

getBoard() - Method in class ChessGame
Getter that returns the ChessBoard object that is currently being used
getCol() - Method in class ChessLocation
Method returns the current column
getCol() - Method in class ChessPiece
Accessor for the current column of the piece
getGame() - Method in class ChessPiece
Accessor for the current game being played
getID() - Method in class ChessPiece
Accessor for the ID of the piece
getLocation() - Method in class ChessPiece
Accessor for the current location of the piece
getPiece(int, int) - Method in class ChessBoard
Method returns the ChessPiece object at a given location
getPlayer() - Method in class ChessPiece
Accessor for the played associated with the piece
getRow() - Method in class ChessLocation
Method returns the current row
getRow() - Method in class ChessPiece
Accessor for the current row of the piece

id - Variable in class ChessPiece
 
isPieceAt(int, int) - Method in class ChessBoard
Method checks if there is a piece currently at the given location

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class PlayGame
Main function where the game is actually played.
moveTo(ChessLocation) - Method in class Bishop
The Bishop can only move in the diagonals Method checks if the move is legal and if it is, moves the Bishop on the board
moveTo(ChessLocation) - Method in class ChessPiece
Method to move at piece on the board from one location to another (Assumes the move is legal, legality has been checked before calling)
moveTo(ChessLocation) - Method in class King
The King can move in any direction but only one square at a time Method checks if the move is legal and if it is, moves the King on the board
moveTo(ChessLocation) - Method in class Knight
The Knight can only move in a 2,1 or 1,2 pattern Method checks if the move is legal and if it is, moves the Knight on the board
moveTo(ChessLocation) - Method in class Pawn
The Pawn can move forward one square at a time or two if it is their first move Method checks if the move is legal and if it is, moves the Pawn on the board
moveTo(ChessLocation) - Method in class Queen
The Queen can move in any direction and as far as she wishes Method checks if the move is legal and if it is, moves the Queen on the board
moveTo(ChessLocation) - Method in class Rook
The Rook can only move in stright lines up, down, left or right Method checks if the move is legal and if it is, moves the Rook on the board

P

Pawn - Class in <Unnamed>
Class that imitates the behavior of the Pawn chess piece
Pawn(String, ChessGame, ChessLocation) - Constructor for class Pawn
Constructor sets the owner, current game, the inital locaiton, the first move status and the character ID of the Pawn
placePieceAt(ChessPiece, ChessLocation) - Method in class ChessBoard
Method needs to be called in conjunction with the remove piece so that after the piece location has been changed Its old location is the then set back to the initial character
PlayGame - Class in <Unnamed>
Creates the actual game and allows the user to move the black pieces around the board
PlayGame() - Constructor for class PlayGame
Constructor is empty becasue there are no instance variables and the main function is used
printBoard() - Method in class ChessBoard
Method to print out the current chess board, it also prints the index along the side so users can know where the piece is and where they want to place the next one
printBoard() - Method in class ChessGame
Method that prints out the board that is currently in use Uses the printBoard method from the ChessBoard class

R

removePiece(ChessLocation) - Method in class ChessBoard
Method takes in a location and then sets that space in the array to null signifying that no piece remains there

Class that imitates the behavior of the Rook chess piece
